The eight causes and conditions for the: Business failure due to not applying themselves to work
A wastrel born into the family who squanders and fritters away their wealth
Asibandhaka's son's speech [sn42.9:5.3]: Asibandhaka's son asks Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta how to refute the Buddha's doctrine
Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta tells Asibandhaka's son to ask the Buddha about his wandering with a large Saṅgha of mendicants during a time of famine and scarcity
Asibandhaka's son asks the Buddha about his wandering with a large Saṅgha of mendicants during a time of famine and scarcity
The Buddha explains that offering almsfood does not ruin families and lists the eight causes and conditions for the ruin of families
Asibandhaka's son praises the Buddha and becomes his lay follower.
